intro: Ornithogalum concinnum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star-of-Bethlem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, cylindrical stems and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Ornithogalum concinnum is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique floral display.
